resources.string: You are on a camping trip with your family and are looking for an area to set up your campfire. You see four possible locations to dig your fire pit. Which of the following locations do you choose?
As you are sitting around the fire with your five year old brother and parents, you need to go to the restroom. You go to the bathroom with:
Your family starts to roast marshmallows, but your marshmallow catches on fire! What do you do?
It\'s getting late, and your family decides to call it a day. What do you do?
You know that your campfire has been fully extinguished and it is safe to leave when:
under a tree with low branches
in an open area
in a windy area
your brother
your parents
your entire family
blow out the fire
wave the marshmallow around until the flame dies
throw the marshmallow away as far as possible
try to blow out the fire with all your might
just leave it there, it will eventually go out on its own
pour lots of water on the fire
You\'ve poured your entire bucket of water on the fire.
The leftover coal and ash is cold to the touch, and you don\'t see any more embers.
There are still a few embers exposed, but they\'ll all go out eventually.
Oh no! One of the tree branches catches on fire. Try again.
Great idea! There\'s nothing around you that can catch on fire.
Uh oh! The wind blows the fire towards a nearby bush, and it catches on fire. Try again.
Good job! This means that there are still adults attending the fire.
Uh oh. The only person left at the fire is your little brother. There should always be an adult at the fire. Try again.
Now everybody has left the fire, but there should always be an adult attending it. Try again.
Good job! You safely blew out your burning marshmallow.
Oh no! The marshmallow hits your brother as you\'re waving it around and he gets burned. Try again.
Oh no! Your burning marshmallow lands in a bush, which catches on fire. Try again.
You won\'t be able to extinguish your fire like this. Try again.
You cannot be sure that the fire goes out. After you leave, it spreads to a bush, which catches on fire. Try again.
Great idea! Pouring water on the fire will make it go out.
Even though you\'ve poured the entire bucket, there could still be leftover embers, which may not go out on their own. Try again.
Good job! Your fire has been completely extinguished, and it is safe to leave.
Uh oh! The fire doesn\'t go out, and there is a gust of wind that blows it towards a bush, which catches on fire. Try again.
